raw_mentions: These antibodies have high binding affinity to FXIIa (e.g., Ki<sup>app</sup><50 pM);

Here are the extracted sentences that meet the criteria:

* In some embodiments, the anti-FXIIa antibody described herein may have a Ki<sup>app </sup>value of 1000, 900, 800, 700, 600, 500, 400, 300, 200, 100, 50, 40, 30, 20, 19, 18, 17, 16, 15, 14, 13, 12, 11, 10, 9, 8, 7, 6, 5 pM or less for the target antigen or antigen epitope.
* Differences in Ki<sup>app </sup>(e.g., for specificity or other comparisons) can be at least 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 5, 10, 15, 20, 37.5, 50, 70, 80, 91, 100, 500, 1000, 10,000 or 10<sup>5 </sup>fold.
* The anti-FXIIa antibody as described herein can bind and inhibit the activity of FXIIa by at least 50% (e.g., 60%, 70%, 80%, 90%, 95% or greater).

The anti-FXIIa antibody described herein may have a binding affinity (K<sub>D</sub>) of at least 10<sup>−5</sup>, 10<sup>−6</sup>, 10<sup>−7</sup>, 10<sup>−8</sup>, 10<sup>−9</sup>, 10<sup>−10 </sup>M, or lower for the target antigen or antigenic epitope.

The anti-FXIIa antibody described herein may have a binding affinity (K<sub>D</sub>) of at least 10<sup>−5</sup>, 10<sup>−6</sup>, 10<sup>−7</sup>, 10<sup>−8</sup>, 10<sup>−9</sup>, 10<sup>−10 </sup>M, or lower for the target antigen or antigenic epitope.

The anti-FXIIa antibody described herein may have a binding affinity (K<sub>D</sub>) of at least 10<sup>−5</sup>, 10<sup>−6</sup>, 10<sup>−7</sup>, 10<sup>−8</sup>, 10<sup>−9</sup>, 10<sup>−10 </sup>M, or lower for the target antigen or antigenic epitope.

The anti-FXIIa antibody described herein may have a binding affinity (K<sub>D</sub>) of at least 10<sup>−5</sup>, 10<sup>−6</sup>, 10<sup>−7</sup>, 10<sup>−8</sup>, 10<sup>−9</sup>, 10<sup>−10 </sup>M, or lower for the target antigen or antigenic epitope.

The anti-FXIIa antibody described herein may have a binding affinity (K<sub>D</sub>) of at least 10<sup>−5</sup>, 10<sup>−6</sup>, 10<sup>−7</sup>, 10<sup>−8</sup>, 10<sup>−9</sup>, 10<sup>−10 </sup>M, or lower for the target antigen or antigenic epitope.

The anti-FXIIa antibody described herein may have a binding affinity (K<sub>D</sub>) of at least 10<sup>−5</sup>, 10<sup>−6</sup>, 10<sup>−7</sup>, 10<sup>−8</sup>, 10<sup>−9</sup>, 10<sup>−10 </sup>M, or lower for the target antigen or antigenic epitope.
The selection produced a selective Fab inhibitor that specifically bound to the catalytic domain of FXIIa with a Ki<sup>app </sup>of 800 pM.
